camel.source.path.routeId.name: camel.source.path.routeId
camel.source.path.routeId.description: The Route ID. Default value notice: The ID will be auto-generated if not provided

camel.source.endpoint.location.name: camel.source.endpoint.location
camel.source.endpoint.location.description: Location of the Kamelet to use which can be specified as a resource from file system, classpath etc. The location cannot use wildcards, and must refer to a file including extension, for example file:/etc/foo-kamelet.xml

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.component.kamelet.location.name: camel.component.kamelet.location
camel.component.kamelet.location.description: The location(s) of the Kamelets on the file system. Multiple locations can be set separated by comma.

camel.component.kamelet.bridgeErrorHandl.name: camel.component.kamelet.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.kamelet.bridgeErrorHandl.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.kamelet.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.kamelet.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.kamelet.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.kamelet.routeTemplateLoa.name: camel.component.kamelet.routeTemplateLoaderListener
camel.component.kamelet.routeTemplateLoa.description: To plugin a custom listener for when the Kamelet component is loading Kamelets from external resources.
